---
title: "Change in reproductive number due to B.1.1.7 spread"
output:
  html_document:
    df_print: paged
---



```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(ggrepel)


r_old = 0.9
r_new =r_old*1.7

n_old = 99
n_new = 1

serial_interval = 6.5

data = tibble(day=-5:200)

data$n_old = n_old*r_old^(data$day/serial_interval)
data$n_new = n_new*r_new^(data$day/serial_interval)

data$ratio_new = data$n_new/(data$n_new+data$n_old)
data$r = r_new*data$ratio_new + r_old*(1-data$ratio_new)
data$date = ymd("2020-01-01") + data$day

data$label = NA

data$label[6]="B.1.1.7 makes up 1% of infections"
data$label[84]="B.1.1.7 makes up 90% of infections"

ggplot(data,aes(x=date,y=r,label=label))+geom_line(color="#1c338e",size=1)+theme_bw()+labs(y="Reproductive number (R)",x="Date",title="Change of reproductive number due to B.1.1.7 spread")+coord_cartesian(ylim=c(0,NA),xlim=c(ymd("2020-01-01"),ymd("2020-04-01")))+ geom_hline(yintercept=1,linetype=2,color="#444444")+geom_label_repel(nudge_x =3,nudge_y =-0.2,color="#444444",size=3)
ggsave("change_in_r.png",width=6.4,height=3.5)

```
